node.title: Why this Queensland island split in two and what happens now
node.alt: The northern tip of Bribie Is has broken off to form a new passage in cyclonic weather.
node.description: Swells from ex-Tropical Cyclone Seth have carved a passage through Bribie Island, and experts say the breach could have significant effects on Caloundra.
node.content:
["Ex-Tropical Cyclone Seth has changed south-east Queensland's coastline, with massive swells buffeting\u00a0Bribie Island's northern tip and splitting the island in two.\u00a0", "High tides and huge seas driven by Seth carved a passage through the northern end of Bribie Island at the end of last year.", "Experts say the new bar could take up to 20 years to close and will eventually become the preferred entry to Caloundra.", "The island's northern tip has gradually been thinning on the ocean and Pumicestone Passage sides, with the surf briefly running over the dunes into the passage during the middle of\u00a0last year.", "The evolving passage\u00a0is now 300 metres wide with a depth of 1.5 metres at high tide and 1 metre at low tide.", "It is so treacherous that two 24-hour cameras were donated and installed to monitor the area after calls for help to the coast guard increased.", "", "
Big swells break\u00a0through the northern end of Bribie Island earlier this month.(Supplied: Doug Bazley, Blueys Photography)
", "Caloundra's Coast Guard Commander, Roger Pearce, said the new bar was not officially classified as a trafficable coastal bar on maps by the harbour master yet, and was currently only used for emergencies.", "\"According to the coastal scientists who have been out with us, the north end of Bribie Island will eventually break up and become sandbars again,\" Mr Pearce said.", "", "
Wild surf is changing the channel conditions every day.(Supplied: Roger Pearce, Caloundra\u00a0Coast Guard)
", "The addition of the\u00a0second camera last week means the coast guard no longer needs to move a single camera between the north and south sides of the passage as curious boaties try their luck in the ever-changing environment.", "Mr Pearce said the Caloundra Coast Guard had\u00a0access to the camera at all times and had responded to 10\u00a0calls for help in the past fortnight, including at least two on Australia Day.", "", "
Crews fit a new surveillance camera to watch over the south bar on Bribie Island.(Supplied: Roger Pearce, Caloundra Coast Guard)
", "
Existing Caloundra bar could close
", "University of the Sunshine Coast\u00a0geologist and coastal erosion expert Javier Leon said the original Caloundra channel north of the Bribie Island bar could change and close.", "He explained what was once part of Bribie Island could become officially part of Caloundra and form a Caloundra spit.", "Mr Leon said it was exciting to be an eyewitness to such\u00a0dynamic changes to the landscape.", "More high tides and storm surges are predicted for the end of the month starting on January 31.", "", "
Geologist and coastal erosion expert Javier Leon.(Supplied:\u00a0University of the Sunshine Coast)
", "\"We're going through a La Ni\u00f1a period, which means, usually for this part of the coast, more energy coming so more easterly waves, and\u00a0that's going to be super interesting to monitor,\" he said.", "\"If we start getting more and more of these events, that's going to accelerate that erosion on the bridge and it's going to be very interesting to see how that affects those banks along the Pumicestone Passage.", "Mr Leon said it was hard to predict what would happen in the future as the situation was \"dynamic\" but said scientists would continue to monitor the situation.", "", "
There are fears the new passage could cause erosion problems for Caloundra's\u00a0Golden Beach (right).(Supplied:\u00a0Doug Bazley, Blueys Photography)
", "
Changing northern face nothing new
", "The changing face of the Caloundra bar is not a new phenomenon.", "Photographer Doug Bazley can vividly recall memories of visiting the circus and holiday fair along Caloundra's sandy spit in the 1980s.", "That area eventually filled with water to become the existing Caloundra bar.", "Now, Mr Bazley has captured in intricate detail the next step in the area's ever-changing scenery \u2014\u00a0the Bribie Island breakthrough.", "For his business, Bluey's Photography, Mr Bazley has been flying his drone over the passage and the new southern bar since the first incursion early in July last year.", "He said it was interesting to see the daily changes from overhead.", "", "
The northern tip of Bribie Island and the Caloundra bar in 2017.(supplied: Doug Bazley, Blueys Photography)
", "\"This recent breakthrough has been pretty substantial \u2026 that's for sure.", "\"The feeling is that finally the north bar\u00a0will close over and the southern bar will be the new bar.", "Mr Bazley said the breach had created issues for some local boat hire businesses because what had\u00a0always been still water now had unpredictable swells, which meant they could no longer hire vessels to inexperienced boaties."]
